page.title: 10MITCHELDEAN PRIMARY SCHOOL
page.content: Mitcheldean Primary School was founded in 1789 by William Lane, a local benefactor who left Â£1000 in his will for the purpose. The old part of the school is still in use as the Upper Junior Department, but with the population increasing a new block of three classrooms was added in the 1960's together with a large playing field. In 1976 a further block of three classrooms was completed to form a new infant department. 1985 was an important one for the school, for after many years of waiting a school hall was at last built. This is octagonal in shape, and includes a block of new offices, store rooms and changing rooms. There are nine classes split between the three blocks of the school, and almost all the children live in Mitcheldean itself.
